page.title: 07BOXFORD CHURCH Cont.
page.content:
There are eight bells made in the year 1404 until 1718. The oldest bell is 500 years old. The youngest bell is 200 years old. The bells are as big as a door, they weigh one ton. The bells are not rung at present because the tower is in danger of crumbling.
Two cleaners get paid to clean the church, but there are lots more who do it for nothing. The whole village are fund raisers for Boxford Church. The church belongs to the whole village. The church is hop0ing for 20,000 pounds to restore the church. The gardener has retired so they hire the contractors. The old things in the church are the chests. Inside the chests are the old bibles and hand bells.
